title: Is this good enough to stream?
body:
I live in a rural area, and the internet can be quite bad.
(Just for streaming)
I live with one house mate, and she usually doesn't download the entire world.

Download speed is - 10.35.
Upload speed is 0.80-90.

I'm with Dodo (I know plz no flame)
And have ADSL 2+.

What are the minimum requirements?
And I have Xsplit, OBS.
Which one is better?
I've had more success streaming (For like 10 seconds)
With XSplit.

replies.body:
OBS is the better streaming software.
but yeah you need NBN or something similar that will give you decent upload speeds.
problem with any form of ADSL is that it's asymmetrical in terms of download and upload speed.

Problem is the upload, 0.80-0.90 is nowhere enough.
The ISPs advertise download speed so much they don't care about upload speed at all.

No, not even close. You will be streaming in like 144p. You ideally want AT LEAST the NBN 5mb UPLOAD to even consider streaming. Which i have and i can comfortable stream at 720p, to go any higher you need more upload speed.

 And if your streaming in less than 720p, don't bother, most people won't watch it, its to gross to watch in this day and age.

Yeah I thought so, problem is.
My towns council (And the government) dont want NBN.
We had a "3 Year Plan" to install NBN to my town, but its only just started. 
It was suppose to be completed 3 months ago.

I'll stick to uploading shit on YouTube.
Thanks.
